name: Shanghai Stir-fried Noodles
recipe: Wash and finely chop the cabbage.
Peel and shred the carrot.
Peel and mince the garlic.
Slice the pork, add 1 tsp of soy sauce, sugar, pepper powder, sesame oil, and oil, and mix well.
Add corn starch, mix well, and marinate for about half an hour.
Soak the dried mushroom until soft and slice.
Bring water to a boil and cook the thick noodles until fully cooked.
Heat oil and stir-fry the pork, minced garlic, and mushrooms until fragrant.
Add the cooked noodles and stir well.
Add the cabbage and carrot and stir well.
Add chicken broth, 2 tsp of soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, and mix well.
Finally, add 1/2 tsp of sesame oil and stir well.

name: Steamed Chicken with Fish Maw
recipe: Soak the dried shiitake mushrooms and fish maw.
Bring water with ginger slices to a boil, cook the fish maw for about 5 minutes, then turn off the heat and soak for about 2 hours.
Grate the ginger and extract the ginger juice.
Thaw and cut the chicken thigh into four pieces.
Add 4g of salt, 8g of sugar, oyster sauce, ground white pepper, and 1/4 tsp of ginger juice to the chicken and mix well.
Then add 10g of oil and 5g of corn starch, mix well, and marinate for about 1-2 hours.
Gently squeeze out the moisture from the fish maw and cut into four pieces.
Squeeze out the moisture from the dried shiitake mushrooms and slice.
Mix the fish maw and mushrooms with 1/4 tsp of ginger juice, 2g of salt, and 4g of sugar.
Then add 5g of oil and 5g of corn starch, and mix well.
Combine all ingredients and steam over medium heat for about 15 minutes.

name: Pork Siu Mai
recipe: Soak the dried shiitake mushrooms until soft and set aside.
Separate the egg yolk from the egg white.
Mix the flour, egg yolk, ⅛ tsp of salt, water, and turmeric powder until a dough forms.
Flatten the dough, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for about half an hour.
Chop the pork and pork lard into smaller pieces.
Chop half the shrimp and flatten the other half for later use.
Chop the soaked shiitake mushrooms into small pieces and set aside.
Mix the pork and flattened shrimp until they become sticky.
Add the chopped mushrooms, pork lard, and shrimp to the mixture.
Add 4 g of salt, sugar, soy sauce, and ground white pepper, and mix well.
Add the pork lard and mix thoroughly.
Add corn starch and mix well, then wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for about half an hour.
Peel the carrot, slice it thinly, and then chop into small pieces.
Dust the countertop with flour and roll out the dough into thin circles.
Cut out circles with a diameter of about 7-8 cm.
Place the pork filling in the center of the dough skin, then top with carrot pieces.
Steam over medium-high heat for 10-15 minutes to finish.

name: Dry-fried Green Beans
recipe: Wash the green beans and set aside.
Peel and mince the garlic and ginger.
Mix soy sauce, vinegar, and sugar together and set aside.
Trim the ends of the green beans, remove the tough fibers from the sides, cut in half, and drain.
Heat oil in a pan, add the green beans and stir-fry until fragrant, then separate and set aside the beans and oil.
Add a little oil and cook the minced pork until done, then set aside.
Add a little more oil and sauté the ginger, garlic, and chili bean sauce over low heat until fragrant.
Add the green beans and minced pork, and stir well.
Add Shaoxing wine and the seasoning mixture, stir well, and it's done.

name: Mixed Cut Steak
recipe: Slice 3 cloves of garlic and rinse to drain.
Fry on low heat until golden brown, then drain and set aside.
Slice ½ onion and set aside.
Cut ¼ onion into pieces and crush with 1 clove of garlic.
Add Japanese soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, and water, and blend into a puree.
Bring the onion juice to a slight boil and set aside.
Cut the steak into pieces and season with an appropriate amount of black pepper and salt.
Heat the pan and sear the steak.
Add the sliced onion and cook the steak to your liking, and it’s done.

name: Japanese Navy Curry
recipe: Peel and chop the potato, onion, and carrot, and set aside.
Cut the chicken thigh into pieces and set aside.
Mix the curry powder and chili powder, toast them over low heat, then set aside.
Melt the butter, add the flour, and cook until slightly brown, then mix in the toasted curry powder and set aside off the heat.
Heat oil in a pan and sear the chicken pieces over high heat.
Add the potato, onion, and carrot, and stir-fry briefly.
Add the curry sauce, chicken broth, and water, and stir well.
Add brown sugar and salt, cover, and simmer on low heat for about half an hour.
Turn off the heat and add chutney, chocolate, and instant coffee, mixing well.

name: Bandit-style Chicken Wings
item: Spicy Powder or Seven Flavour Powder
recipe: Rinse the chicken wings and dry them thoroughly.
Add garlic salt and rice wine to the chicken wings.
Mix them well.
Add sugar, corn starch, light soy sauce, oyster sauce, cumin powder, Chinese five spice, and spicy powder or seven flavour powder to the chicken wings.
Mix well again.
Cover with plastic wrap.
Take out and preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
Dip the marinated sauce and place on the baking tray.
Sprinkle more cumin powder on each chicken wing.
Bake at 200 degrees Celsius for 12 minutes or more.
note: This dish is spicy and delicious, perfect for pairing with drinks.

name: Pickled Pepper Chicken Wings
recipe: Thaw the chicken wings and set aside.
Mix 500g of water, salt, Shaoxing wine, and 2 slices of ginger and bring to a boil.
Add the chicken wings, bring to a boil, then reduce to low heat and cook for about 10 minutes.
Cut the pickled peppers in half and chop the hot pepper.
Mix Sichuan peppercorn, hot pepper, pickled peppers, 2 slices of ginger, white vinegar, chicken broth, 100g water, salt, and sugar, bring to a boil, and let cool.
Soak the chicken wings in ice water to cool.
Drizzle the chicken wings with the pickled pepper sauce, place in a container, and refrigerate for about 1 to 2 days.

name: Korean Braised Short Ribs
recipe: Introduction to Korean Braised Short Ribs.
Peel and chop the carrots and radish.
Cut the king oyster mushrooms and shiitake mushrooms into pieces.
Peel and core the Asian pear, then chop.
Slice the ginger and peel the garlic, remove the stem from the chili, and chop the onion.
Cut the short ribs into pieces.
Blend the chili, garlic, and ginger first, then add the Asian pear and soy sauce to make the sauce.
Sear the short ribs briefly.
Add the carrots and radish, sauce, brown sugar, and sesame oil, stir well, add water, cover, and simmer on low heat for about 15 minutes.
Add the onion, shiitake mushrooms, and king oyster mushrooms, stir well, and cover to cook for about 10 minutes.
Stir gently, then uncover and cook for another 5-10 minutes to reduce the sauce.

name: Oyster Congee
recipe: Wash the oysters and drain.
Wash the dried flounder fish, remove excess parts, and cut into small pieces.
Wash and chop the coriander.
Marinate the minced pork with soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, pepper powder, and Shaoxing wine for half an hour.
Dry-fry the dried flounder fish in a pan until fragrant.
Soak the rice in water and use your hands to break up the grains.
Heat oil and sauté the minced pork until fragrant.
Add chicken broth, dried flounder, water, rice, and preserved cabbage; bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the seasonings, mix well, cover, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the oysters and coriander, stir well, and cook over low heat until done.

name: Black Pepper Short Ribs
recipe: Peel and slice the onion into strips, and mince the garlic.
Wash the beef short ribs and cut into pieces.
Add 1 tsp of soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, black pepper, and 1/4 tsp of sugar, and mix well.
Gradually add enough water, corn starch, and oil, mix well, and marinate for about half an hour.
Mix 2 tsp of soy sauce, 1 tsp of sugar, and oyster sauce together.
Add Worcestershire sauce, Maggi seasoning, and 100 ml of water, and mix well.
Heat oil and sear the beef short ribs over high heat until 70-80% cooked, then set aside.
Sauté the minced garlic and 1 tsp of black pepper until fragrant.
Add the sliced onion and sauté until fragrant.
Add the sauce and cook until the onion is soft, adding water as needed.
Add the beef short ribs and cook on medium-low heat until fully cooked.
Mix the corn starch with water, then add and stir well.
Add sesame oil and mix well to finish.

name: Salt and Pepper Pork Chop
recipe: Pound the pork chops to tenderize and cut them into wide strips.
Add soy sauce, 3 tsp of Shaoxing wine, 1/2 tsp of sugar, and ground white pepper, and mix well.
Add water as needed and mix well.
Add corn starch and cooking oil, and mix well.
Separate the green onion into white parts and chopped green parts.
Chop the red chili pepper and set aside.
Peel and mince the garlic, dividing it into two portions; rinse one half and drain.
Heat oil and fry the minced garlic over medium-low heat until golden brown.
Add the pork chops and fry over low heat until golden brown and cooked through, then remove.
Sauté the white parts of the green onion and the fried garlic until fragrant.
Add chili bean sauce, five spice powder, and ground white pepper, and stir well.
Add salt and 1/8 tsp of sugar, and mix well.
Add 2 tsp of Shaoxing wine and mix well.
Add the pork chops, red chili pepper, and chopped green onion; stir until well combined and dry.
Add the fried garlic to the salt and pepper pork chops to finish.

name: Soy Sauce Lo Mein
recipe: Peel and slice the garlic.
Peel and slice the shallot into thin strips.
Heat oil and add the shallots and garlic, frying over low heat until golden brown.
Combine dark soy sauce, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, chicken powder, and water, and bring to a boil.
Strain the fried shallots and garlic from the oil, then mix in the sesame oil and set aside.
Heat oil in a pot and fry the triangular fish blocks over medium heat until golden brown.
Bring water to a boil, add the thick noodles, cook until done, and then rinse with cold water.
Return the thick noodles to hot water for a few seconds, then remove.
Add about 1 tbsp of the soy sauce mixture and mix well.
Add the shallot and garlic oil and mix well.
Add the fish blocks, shichimi, and fried shallots and garlic to serve, and it's done.

name: Cheese Cream Shrimp Pasta
recipe: Boil water with salt, cook fettuccine according to package instructions minus one minute.
Peel and crush the garlic and set aside.
Zest the lemon, slice it, and remove the seeds.
Melt the butter, add garlic and lemon slices, and mix well.
Add the shrimp and stir-fry until cooked, then set aside, removing the lemon slices and garlic.
Heat the whipping cream with salt over low heat, stirring well.
Add the shrimp, lemon zest, and Parmesan cheese, and mix well.
Add the fettuccine, mix well over low heat, and serve.
Sprinkle with a little black pepper and Parmesan cheese, and it’s done.

name: Seafood Cheese Pasta
recipe: Melt the butter and add the flour, mixing well.
Once the butter bubbles, gradually add the milk while mixing.
Add salt and sugar, mixing until it boils and thickens.
Add the shredded Parmesan cheese and mix well, then set aside.
Boil water with salt and cook the fettuccine according to package instructions.
Peel and mince the garlic.
Season the seafood with salt and black pepper and set aside.
Drain the cooked fettuccine and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté the minced garlic until fragrant, then add the seafood and stir-fry.
Add white wine and fettuccine, mixing well.
Reduce the heat and add the white sauce, mixing thoroughly.
Transfer the fettuccine to an oven-safe dish and top with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Preheat the oven and bake at the highest setting for 5-10 minutes until the top is golden brown.

name: Guanciale Tomato Pasta
recipe: Introduction to Guanciale Tomato Pasta.
Bring 1 liter of water with ¼ tsp of salt to a boil, add the pasta, and cook according to package instructions, reserving the pasta water.
Slice the guanciale into small pieces and set aside.
Grate the cheese and set aside.
Sauté the guanciale until the fat is rendered.
Add black pepper, red pepper flakes, and white wine.
Add the canned tomatoes, cover, and cook until thickened, adjusting seasoning as needed.
Add the pasta and enough reserved pasta water, cooking until the sauce reduces.
Mix in the cheese and plate.
Sprinkle additional cheese on top of the pasta.

name: Porcini Cream Pasta
recipe: Soak the dried porcini mushrooms in water for about 30 minutes, then drain and chop finely.
Peel and mince the garlic and set aside.
Bring a pot of water to a boil, add salt and cook the fettuccine according to package instructions.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté the minced garlic until fragrant.
Add the chopped porcini mushrooms and salt, and sauté over medium heat.
Add black pepper and cook until the porcini mushrooms are slightly softened.
Add white wine and whipping cream, stirring to combine.
Add the cooked fettuccine and adjust with reserved pasta water as needed, then turn off the heat.
Mix in the Parmigiano Reggiano and plate to serve.

name: Pudding
recipe: In a pot, mix 30g of sugar with 3 tablespoons of water. Heat until deep brown. Add 3 tablespoons of hot water to the caramel syrup and pour it into the pudding mold.
In a bowl, whisk together 2 whole eggs, 2 egg yolks, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
In another microwave-safe bowl or pot, heat 35g sugar and 250g milk for 1 minute 30 seconds, or until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Gradually pour the milk mixture into the beaten eggs while stirring. Strain the mixture twice to ensure a smooth and creamy texture.
Let the pudding cool for a few minutes, then refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
note: 這道布丁口感滑順，非常美味. This pudding has a smooth texture and is very delicious.

name: No-bake Strawberry Cheesecake
recipe: Crush the biscuits and mix with melted butter. Press into the bottom of the mold.
Mix cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, and milk together.
Dissolve gelatin in water and add to the mixture.
Add strawberry purée and mix well.
Whip heavy cream and sugar, then fold into the mixture.
Pour the mixture into the prepared mold and refrigerate.
To make strawberry purée: blend strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice.
To make strawberry jelly: mix strawberry purée, water, and gelatin.
To make lemon jelly: mix water, lemon juice, sugar, and gelatin.
Chill the jelly and top it on the cheesecake.
note: This rare cheesecake has a refreshing taste, perfect for dessert.

name: Chocolate Cookies
recipe: Melt the butter and set aside.
Chop the chocolate chunks and set aside.
Beat the egg and set aside.
Mix the flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda.
Add soft brown sugar, sugar/trehalose, and salt, and mix well.
Add vanilla extract and chocolate chunks, and mix well.
Add the melted butter and beaten egg, and mix until there are no flour lumps.
Let it rest for about half an hour, and preheat the oven to 180°C.
Divide the dough into six pieces (about 40g each
* Ensure enough space between the cookies.
Bake for about 3-5 minutes, and it's done.

name: Peach Resin and Snow Lotus Dessert
recipe: Soak peach resin, snow lotus seed, and snow swallow for about 7-8 hours or overnight.
Remove impurities from peach resin and snow swallow, then rinse.
Cut the red dates in half and remove the pits, soak the dried longan for about 10 minutes.
Cut off the top of the papaya and scoop out the seeds and flesh.
Add water, slab sugar, red dates, and dried longan to a pot and bring to a boil.
Add peach resin and snow swallow, and cook for about 10-15 minutes.
Finally, add snow lotus seed and osmanthus syrup, and cook for about 1 minute.
Pour the syrup into the papaya bowl and steam over medium-low heat for about 5-10 minutes, and it's done.

name: Golden Monk Fruit Sweet Soup
recipe: Wash the monk fruit and break it into small pieces.
Add the monk fruit and water, then boil for about half an hour and strain.
Soak the snow fungus until soft, tear it apart, and trim away the harder parts.
Add the monk fruit water, snow fungus, red dates, and longan to a pot, cover, and cook for about half an hour.
Adjust the consistency and flavor by adding more water as needed and stir to finish.

name: Brown Sugar Glutinous Rice Cakes
recipe: Combine 40 ml of hot water and sugar with the glutinous rice flour and mix well.
Add about 30 ml of water and mix until a dough forms.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, roll it out into a rectangle, and cut into strips.
Cook the brown sugar, water, and salt over low heat until thickened, then turn off the heat.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the dough strips over medium-low heat until golden brown, then remove.
Sprinkle the surface of the rice cakes with soy bean powder and drizzle with the brown sugar syrup to finish.

name: Pancakes
recipe: Beat the egg with milk and melted butter.
Then combine the cake flour, baking powder, and sugar until smooth.
Pour the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan and gently pour in the batter; cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip.
Cook both sides until golden brown, then serve.

name: Basque Burnt Cheesecake
recipe: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
Mix the egg yolks, honey, and milk together.
Add the sifted cake flour and mix until there are no lumps.
Preheat the oven to 170°C and line the cake pan with parchment paper.
Beat the egg whites with sugar until stiff peaks form.
Gradually fold the meringue into the egg yolk mixture using a cutting motion.
Add the vegetable oil and mix gently.
Pour the batter into the cake pan and gently tap to level.
Bake at 170°C for 15 minutes, then lower the temperature to 150°C and bake for another 25 minutes, rotating the cake halfway for even cooking.
Remove the cake from the oven, invert to cool, unmold, and gently brush off any crumbs.
Melt the sliced cheese, unsalted butter, honey, and milk over low heat, while preheating the oven to 220°C.
Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the surface of the cake.
Bake at 220°C for 3-4 minutes until the surface is slightly charred, then it's done.

name: Japanese Teriyaki Sauce
recipe: Combine soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil in a bowl.
Heat a pot over low heat.
Dissolve the starch in water.
Pour the soy sauce mixture into the pot.
Heat over low and then add the starch water to the pot.
